translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Upāli
The Elder Bhāgineyyupāli’s Birth Story
Surrounded by a thousand of those whose corruptions are destroyed,
the Leader of the World,
devoted to solitude,
went to go into solitary retreat.
I was dressed in deerskin,
wearing a triple-stick ascetic’s staff,
and I saw the Leader of the World,
surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.
I put my deerskin over one shoulder,
put my hands together,
and after worshipping the Buddha,
I consoled the Leader of the World.
Just as those born from eggs, from the womb,
from moisture, and spontaneously born,
all the birds such as crows,
always move through the sky.
Whatever living beings there are,
whether they have perception or not,
all of them are within your knowledge,

original: anto honti samogadhā.🔽Gandhā ca pabbateyyā ye,
analyzed: antar honti samogadhā  gandhāḥ ca pabbateyyāḥ ye
translated: completely included.🔽The perfumes from the mountains,

analyzed: himavant anaguttame  sabbe te tava sīlamhi
translated: from the Himalayas, the most excellent of mountains,🔽all of them are not equal to a fraction

analyzed: kalāyapi na yuj jare  moha ndhakāra pakkhando
translated: of your virtue.🔽This world with its gods,
with the darkness of delusion dispelled,
when your knowledge shines,
the darkness is destroyed.
Just as when the sun has set,

analyzed: honti sattā tamaḥ gatā  evam buddhe an uppanne
translated: Beings are in darkness,🔽Thus the world is in darkness,
Until the Buddha arises.
Just as the rising sun
Always dispels the darkness,
So you, best of Buddhas,
Always destroy the darkness.
You are diligent,
The Buddha in the world with the gods;
Through your successful deeds,
You satisfy the multitude of people.’
Having rejoiced in all that,
The great sage Padumuttara;
The wise one rose up into the sky,🔽Like the king of swans in the sky.
Having risen up, the Fully Enlightened One,
The great sage Padumuttara;
The Teacher, standing in the sky,
Spoke these verses:
By which this knowledge was attained,
Endowed with similes;
I will proclaim it,
Listen to me as I speak.
Eighteen times he will be
King of the gods,
Three hundred times he will rule the earth,
Dwelling on the earth.
Twenty-five times he will be
A Wheel-turning Monarch;
An extensive regional kingdom,
Incalculable in number.
In the course of a hundred thousand eons,

analyzed: okkāka kula sambhavaḥ  gotamaḥ nāma gottena
translated: one born in the family of the crows,🔽will be a teacher in the world,
known by the clan name of Gotama.
Having passed away from the Tusita heaven,
urged on by the root of virtue,
though born in a low family,
he will be known as Upāli.
Having gone forth later on,
having cooled off evil,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.

analyzed: tuṭṭhaḥ ca gotamaḥ buddho  sakya puttaḥ mahāyasaḥ
translated: The Buddha Gotama was pleased,🔽the son of the Sakyans, of great fame;
he placed me at the head
of those who have mastered the Monastic Law.’
I went forth out of faith,
my work done, without pollutants;
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.

analyzed: bhagavā ca anukampī  vinaya iham visāradaḥ  ca
translated: The Buddha, who has compassion for me,🔽I am confident in the Monastic Law;
I live without pollutants,🔽pleased with my own work.
I am restrained in the Monastic Code,
and in the five senses;
I remember the entire Monastic Law,
a complete treasure.🔽The unsurpassed teacher in the world,
knowing my qualities,
while sitting in the Sangha of monks,
placed me at the head.”
The four discriminations,
and the eight liberations,
The six super-knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.”🔽Thus has it been heard by me.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā upāli thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai upāli theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Elder Upāli recited these verses.
The first chapter.
